meanings.definition: A person who dishonestly claims to have special knowledge and skill in some field, typically medicine.
meanings.sent1: The town was fooled by the quacksalvers who promised miracle cures.
meanings.sent2: The quacksalvers were exposed when their fake medicines did not work.
meanings.sent3: The quacksalvers tried to sell a potion that turned out to be colored water.
meanings.sent4: The quacksalvers' deceitful practices were like a dark cloud over the medical community.
meanings.sent5: The image of the quacksalvers pretending to be doctors stuck in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: To falsely claim to have medical skills or knowledge.

meanings.sent2: She quacksalversed about her experience in treating rare diseases.
meanings.sent3: The man tried to quacksalvers his way through the medical exam, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to quacksalvers her qualifications were quickly uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The con artist managed to quacksalvers his way into the hospital, but was caught red-handed.
